cluster_relations.rel_desc: Color psychology in branding is said to help businesses in their branding efforts.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Form: understanding and application of color psychology

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Applying color psychology in branding helps brands connect more effectively with their target audience.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject improves the strength, quality, or effectiveness of connection or engagement with the object (typically an audience or stakeholder group).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Color psychology in branding enables the use of colors to create brand differentiation.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).

qualifiers.LogicalMarker: and (part of a list of effects)

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Leveraging color psychology in branding enables the creation of a successful and memorable brand.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Brand Outcome: Successful and Memorable Brand

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: requires carefully choosing the right colors and considering cultural and contextual factors
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: if businesses carefully choose colors and consider cultural/contextual factors

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A strong and impactful brand visual identity contributes to having a successful and memorable brand.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Brand Outcome: Successful and Memorable Brand

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when based on effective use of color psychology
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: if the identity resonates with the target audience

remarks: Not explicitly causal but strongly implied as part of the pathway to brand success.
Not explicitly causal but strongly implied as part of the pathway to brand success.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding-related construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (such as brands, businesses, consumer responses, brand perceptions, or branding outcomes).
args.justification: The existing description for the canonical predicate 'influences' is slightly too narrow, focusing only on consumer responses, perceptions, and outcomes. In these instances, the object includes businesses and brands themselves as well as branding outcomes. Broadening the description to cover brands, businesses, and outcomes better reflects the actual usage of this predicate across these relations while keeping the same canonical_rel_name and classes.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding-related construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (such as brands, businesses, consumer responses, brand perceptions, or branding outcomes).
executed_decisions.justification: The existing description for the canonical predicate 'influences' is slightly too narrow, focusing only on consumer responses, perceptions, and outcomes. In these instances, the object includes businesses and brands themselves as well as branding outcomes. Broadening the description to cover brands, businesses, and outcomes better reflects the actual usage of this predicate across these relations while keeping the same canonical_rel_name and classes.
